author: Special Correspondent
text:
Residents throwing stones at policemen after three children were run over by a lorry on the Belgharia Expressway in North 24 Parganas district of West Bengal on Monday.— PHOTO: PTI

Three children were killed and two others sustained grievous injuries by a speeding truck near Belghoria Expressway in State’s North 24 Parganas district on Monday, triggering massive protests by locals.

Two police vehicles were attacked and set on fire at the expressway by the locals. Following the incident, clashes erupted between the locals and the police and several people sustained injuries.

According to the locals, the truck was being chased by a police vehicle, which resulted in the accident.

Sandip Hela and his sister Mala were standing at a bus stop in Mathcolony area with five children, all less than 10 years old, when the speeding truck ran over them. While the vehicle was impounded, the driver fled. “The Deputy Commissioner, Detective Department of the Barrackpore Police Commissionerate, has been asked to conduct an inquiry,” Neeraj Kumar Singh, Commissioner, Barrackpore Commissionerate, said.
title: Speeding truck kills three children in Bengal
